Entries.default:
The dragon - or this rotting shell shaped like a dragon - turns a glowing eye upon you. You feel its gaze upon your soul, prying at your spirit.

A low growl rumbles from its maw. Though menacing - the snarl does not resolve into words.

The dragon - or this rotting shell shaped like a dragon - does not notice you until you're upon it. Then its head whips about with a snort that sends purple flames flickering from its rotting nostrils.

You feel its gaze upon your soul, prying at your spirit.
"What are you doing to these people?"
"You're supposed to be the messenger of Rymrgand?"
[Leave] "Didn't mean to interrupt. I'll be on my way."
The creature snorts - an unmistakably derisive sound accompanied by flickering purple light from its rotting nostrils - and lifts one of the dead harbingers to its mouth. It bites the elf's arm off.
The creature's mouth curls over rotting fangs as its laughter plays along the edges or your thoughts.
The dragon shifts its weight, crushing snow beneath its clawed feet as it turns towards you. You hear its laughter at the edge of your thoughts.
The dragon shifts its weight, crushing snow and ice beneath its clawed feet as it turns on you.
"What are you doing to these people?"
"You're supposed to be the messenger of Rymrgand?"
"In my experience, dragons usually love the sound of their own voice."

<ispeech>While your subtlety impresses, it does not obligate me to entertain your questions.</ispeech>

Her words worm their way through your thoughts like maggots.
